p: Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), a negative-sense single-stranded enveloped RNA virus, is a global human pathogen responsible for lower respiratory tract infections and is considered as the major viral pathogen of the lower respiratory tract of infants. Therefore, there are urgent need to utilize convenient strategies to prevent RSV infection, including beside of live attenuated, chimeric, and subunit vaccines also nanosized particles (Borchers et al. 2013; Clark and Guerrero-Plata 2017).
